property.description: If selected code for parameter checking is included in the build.
When FIFOs are enabled, a transmit FIFO replaces mailboxes 24-27 and a receive FIFO replaces mailboxes 28-31.

constraint.display: Requires CAN callback to be an application function name (not NULL).
Only one driver instance is allowed per CAN channel
Driver instances must have unique names
Requires CAN peripheral
ICLK must be exactly twice the frequency of PCLKB.
PCLKA must be exactly twice the frequency of PCLKB.
Main oscillator(XTAL) must be populated when using CANMCLK. PCLKB must be set as clock source when XTAL is not populated.
The maximum number of mailboxes available in FIFO mode is 24.

property.description: Module name.

constraint.display: Name must be a valid C symbol

property.description: Specify the CAN channel to use.

constraint.display: Channel should be 0 or 1

property.description: Select the CAN clock source.
Sample-Point = (TSEG1 + 1) / (TSEG1 + TSEG2 + 1).

constraint.display: Must be a valid integer between 0 and 100. Ignore when Override Baud Settings is Enabled.

property.display: Baud Rate Settings|Auto-generated Settings|CAN Baud Rate (Hz)
property.description: Specify baud rate in Hz.\n\nIf the requested baud rate cannot be achieved, the settings with the largest possible baud rate that is less than or equal to the requested baud rate is used. If multiple combinations would result in the best baud rate, the combination with the least absolute error for the ratio is chosen. The theoretical calculated baud rate and ratio are printed in a comment in the generated can_bit_timing_cfg_t structure.

constraint.display: Must be a valid integer configurable upto maximum 1MHz. Ignore when Override Baud Settings is Enabled.

property.export: eval('' + '/* INPUTS */' + ' var rate = "${module.driver.can.baud_rate}";' + ' var clock = ${board.clock.peripheral.can};' + ' var req_ratio = ${module.driver.can.sample_point};' + ' var clock_source = "${module.driver.can.clock_source}";' + ' var k = 0;' + ' var tseg1 = 0;' + ' var tseg2 = 0;' + ' var tseg = 0;' + ' var sjw = 0;' + ' var best_match = 0;' + ' var best_prescalar = 0;' + ' var best_tseg1 = 0;' + ' var best_tseg2 = 0;' + ' var ratio = 0;' + ' var best_ratio_delta = 100;' + ''+ ' if("CAN_CLOCK_SOURCE_CANMCLK" == clock_source)' + ' {' + ' clock = ${board.clock.peripheral.canmclk};' + ' }' + ''+ ' for(k = 0; k < 1023; k++)' + ' {' + ' for(tseg1 = 4; tseg1 < 17; tseg1++)' + ' {' + ' for(tseg2 = 2; tseg2 < 9; tseg2++)' + ' {' + ' ratio = (tseg1 + 1) * 100 / (tseg1 + tseg2 + 1);' + ' ratio_error = ratio - req_ratio;' + ' if (ratio_error < 0)' + ' {' + ' ratio_error = -ratio_error;' + ' }' + ' if(tseg1 > tseg2)' + ' {' + ' baud = (clock / ((1 + tseg1 + tseg2)*(k+1)));' + ' if((baud <= rate) && (baud > best_match))' + ' {' + ' best_match = baud;' + ' best_prescalar = k;' + ' best_tseg1 = tseg1;' + ' best_tseg2 = tseg2;' + ' best_ratio_delta = ratio_error;' + ' }' + ' else if((baud == best_match))' + ' {' + ' if (ratio_error < best_ratio_delta)' + ' {' + ' best_ratio_delta = ratio_error;' + ' best_prescalar = k;' + ' best_tseg1 = tseg1;' + ' best_tseg2 = tseg2;' + ' }' + ' }' + ' }' + ' }' + ' }' + ' }' + '' + ' if(best_tseg2 <=4 && best_tseg2 >= 2)' + ' {' + ' sjw = best_tseg2;' + ' }' + ' else if(best_tseg2 > 4)' + ' {' + ' sjw = 4;' + ' }' + ' else' + ' {' + ' sjw = 1;' + ' }' + '' + ' ratio = (best_tseg1 + 1) / (best_tseg1 + best_tseg2 + 1);' + ' ratio = ratio.toFixed(2)*100;' + '' + '' + ' bit_timing_cfg = "/* Actual bitrate: " + best_match.toFixed(0) + " Hz. Actual Bit Time Ratio: "+ ratio +" %. */ " + ' + ' " .baud_rate_prescaler = 1 +" + best_prescalar.toString() + " /* Division value of baud rate prescaler */" +' + ' ", .time_segment_1 = " + best_tseg1.toString() +' + ' ", .time_segment_2 = " + best_tseg2.toString() +' + ' ", .synchronization_jump_width = " + sjw.toString();' + ' bit_timing_cfg' + '')

property.display: Baud Rate Settings|Override Auto-generated Settings|Override Baud Settings
property.description: Override calculated baudrate parameters and instead use the ones specified below. This option ignores the parameters specified under Sample-Point (%) and CAN Baud Rate (Hz)

property.display: Baud Rate Settings|Override Auto-generated Settings|Baud Rate Prescaler
property.description: Specify division value of baud rate prescaler (baud rate prescalar + 1).

constraint.display: Value must be a non-negative integer between 1 and 1024.

property.display: Baud Rate Settings|Override Auto-generated Settings|Time Segment 1
property.description: Select the time segment 1 value. (4-16). Check module usage notes for how to calculate this value.

property.display: Baud Rate Settings|Override Auto-generated Settings|Time Segment 2
property.description: Select the time segment 2 value (2-8). Check module usage notes for how to calculate this value.

property.display: Baud Rate Settings|Override Auto-generated Settings|Synchronization Jump Width
property.description: Select the Synchronization Jump Width value (1-4). Check module usage notes for how to calculate this value.
A user callback function. If this callback function is provided, it is called from the interrupt service routine (ISR) each time any interrupt occurs.

constraint.display: Name must be a valid C symbol

property.description: Select whether receive mailbox will be overwritten or overrun if data is not read in time.
Select whether the driver will use CAN Standard IDs, Extended IDs or a mix of both.
Select 4, 8, 16, 24 or 32 mailboxes. In FIFO mailbox mode up to 24 mailboxes are available.
Select the first ID for the receive FIFO, between 0 and 0x7ff when using standard IDs, between 0 and 0x1FFFFFFF when using extended IDs.

constraint.display: Value must be decimal or HEX integer of 0x1FFFFFFF or less.

property.description: Select the second ID for the receive FIFO, between 0 and 0x7ff when using standard IDs, between 0 and 0x1FFFFFFF when using extended IDs.

constraint.display: Value must be decimal or HEX integer of 0x1FFFFFFF or less.

property.description: Select the receive ID for mailbox 0, between 0 and 0x7ff when using standard IDs, between 0 and 0x1FFFFFFF when using extended IDs. Value is not used when the mailbox is set as transmit type.

constraint.display: Value must be decimal or HEX integer of 0x1FFFFFFF or less.

property.description: Select whether the mailbox is used to capture data frames or remote frames (ignored for transmit mailboxes).
Select the Mask for the receive FIFO. In Mixed ID Mode the Standard ID mask is the upper 11 bits of the full 29-bit mask value.

constraint.display: Value must be decimal or HEX integer of 0x1FFFFFFF or less.

property.description: Select the Mask for the receive FIFO. In Mixed ID Mode the Standard ID mask is the upper 11 bits of the full 29-bit mask value.

constraint.display: Value must be decimal or HEX integer of 0x1FFFFFFF or less.

property.description: Transmit/Receive/Error interrupt priority.
Select whether the receive FIFO should throw an interrupt on every received message or when it becomes empty.
